statement.p: When sound travels from one material into another, some of the sound (energy) is reflected rather than entering the new material. The percent reflected is given by \displaystyle{R}=\frac{{\left({Z}_{{2}}-{Z}_{{1}}\right)}^{{2}}}{{\left({Z}_{{2}}+{Z}_{{1}}\right)}^{{2}}} where \displaystyle{Z}_{{1}} and \displaystyle{Z}_{{2}} are the acoustic impedance values for the two substances. Given that \displaystyle{Z}_{{1}}={385} for air and \displaystyle{Z}_{{2}}={36777900} for brass, what is the reflection percent?
